repnme.cdata!:
Congo, Democratic Republic of - Economic
            Recovery and Post-Reunification Economic Recovery Credits;
            Congo, Republic of - Post-Conflict Economic Rehabilitation
            and Economic Recovery Credits

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings of the Project Performance
            Assessment Report (PPAR) generally concur with the
            Implementation Completion Report (ICR) ratings, except in
            the following instances: ratings for the Assessment of the
            Economic Recovery Credit Project are as follows: outcome
            (ICR highly satisfactory, PPAR unsatisfactory); bank
            performance (ICR satisfactory, PPAR moderately
            unsatisfactory); borrower performance (ICR highly
            satisfactory, PPAR moderately unsatisfactory). Ratings for
            the Assessment of the Post-Reunification Economic Recovery
            Credit Project are as follows: outcome (ICR unsatisfactory,
            PPAR unsatisfactory); borrower and bank performance (ICR
            unsatisfactory, PPAR moderately unsatisfactory).Ratings for
            the Assessment of the Post-Conflict Economic Rehabilitation
            Credit Project are as follows: outcome (ICR satisfactory,
            PPAR unsatisfactory); bank performance (ICR satisfactory,
            PPAR unsatisfactory); borrower performance (ICR
            satisfactory, PPAR unsatisfactory). Ratings for the
            Assessment of the Economic Recovery Credit Project are as
            follows: outcome (ICR unsatisfactory, PPAR unsatisfactory);
            borrower and bank performance (ICR moderately
            unsatisfactory, PPAR unsatisfactory). Some lessons learned
            included:  deep reforms changing the patterns of governance
            and public sector management require adequate preparation,
            including political economy assessment, consensus building
            effort and wide political and social ownership. In the
            absence of such thorough preparation, the likelihood of
            success is low, irrespective of potentially huge long-run
            gains for the country and society. In the post-conflict
            environment, a development policy operation (DPO) instrument
            can be effective if the reform program is well calibrated to
            a context of weak technical capacity and multiple
            priorities. In both countries, and for each operation,
            ownership of reforms was permanently elusive, and was only
            assured fleetingly by the lure of arrears clearance or debt
            relief. Ownership of reforms by respective governments
            followed a pattern of temporary commitment to reforms for
            immediate returns. Incentives to governments, leadership and
            ground conditions lacked for a successful pursuit of the
            ambitious reform agenda in both counties.

TF052010-DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO -
            ARREARS CLEARANCE TO AFDB,TFM52010-DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO -

repnme.cdata!:
Congo, Democratic Republic of - Economic
            Recovery Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory, and
            sustainability likely, although institutional development
            impacts are rated as modest. The main lesson highlights the
            fact that, despite countries affected by conflict, with
            institutions weakened by years of institutional decline and
            conflict, the design and implementation of programs, with a
            visible impact on the human scale is attainable. The bold
            project approach contributed significantly to the peace
            process, in that it provided a perspective of renewed
            cooperation, and return to economic growth, supported by a
            political leadership, and commitment to the implementation
            of reforms, the drafting of legislation, and
            institutionalizing reforms in key areas of governance, and
            finance. The appropriate identification of the
            country's specific needs through the Bank's
            strategy - the transitional support strategy (TSS) -
            conduced to stabilization, followed by the adjustment
            program, and, served as an instrument guiding, and ensuring
            consistency of the project objectives. Upon the
            authorities' concern on delays regarding the transfer
            of funds, and, in response to this issue, the Bank agreed -
            that given the functional problems in the banking system,
            and, under a follow-up operation to this project - funds
            would be deposited directly into well-regulated commercial
            banks, subject to appropriate fiduciary arrangements already
            in place.

4473822.trustfund:
TF052010-DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO -
            ARREARS CLEARANCE TO AFDB

repnme.cdata!:
Congo, Democratic Republic of - Economic
            Recovery Credit Project : Release of the Mining Sector Tranche

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Recovery Credit Project
            supports broad reforms in forestry, mining, public
            enterprise, finance, governance and anti-corruption.
            Consequently, the Government successfully initiated a
            macroeconomic policy framework for growth and poverty
            reduction, that, notwithstanding higher than programmed net
            credit to government, lower accumulation of foreign
            reserves, and higher inflation than programmed, is
            consistent with the objectives of the reform program. This
            tranche release of the mining sector is now available for
            disbursement as provided in Section 3.01 and Schedule 1 of
            the Development Credit Agreement, following consultations on
            the reviewed progress achieved in implementing the program.
            In light of the satisfactory progress achieved, and the
            consistency of the macroeconomic policy framework for growth
            and poverty reduction with the objectives of the reform
            program, it is the conclusion that all specific conditions
            pertaining to the release of the mining sector tranche have
            been met.

Congo, Democratic Republic of - Economic
            Recovery Credit Project : Release of the Mining Sector Tranche

5085513.trustfund:
TF052010-DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO -
            ARREARS CLEARANCE TO AFDB
5085513.majtheme: Public sector governance,Financial and private sector development,Economic management

repnme.cdata!:
Congo, Democratic Republic of - Economic
            Recovery Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Recovery Credit Project, as
            an integral part of the Bank's transitional support
            strategy to assist the country in its economic, and social
            recovery, (supported by the resolution of the Bank and the
            International Development Association (IDA) on debt
            arrears), will support policies that stabilize the economy,
            to pave the way to an environmentally, and socially
            sustainable growth, and poverty reduction. The project will
            focus on the development, and poverty reduction reform
            agenda, by providing development leadership needed for the
            reengagement with the international community. This project
            will be implemented in parallel with the Emergency
            Multi-sector Rehabilitation and Reconstruction Program,
            aimed at the rehabilitation of social infrastructure.
            Nonetheless, among the primary risks - and associated
            mitigating measures - there is potentially: the recurrence
            for renewed internal or regional conflict, though reduced by
            the Lusaka peace process, by the United Nations
            intervention, and a Bank-led multinational regional
            demobilization, and reinsertion program; and, the loss of
            international financial support, and fall into debt service
            arrears, though mitigated by the overall program of
            multi-year assistance, with an agreed financing plan, by the
            project's foreign exchange (freed by the project
            itself), and by renewed access to IDA resources - only if
            debt service is maintained.

Congo, Democratic Republic of - Economic
